conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
When the light source moves backward, the distance between the objects and the light source increases.
As the distance between the objects and the light source increases, the shadows cast by the objects will become larger due to the increased angle of the light rays.
The shadows will also move backward because the light source is moving backward, and the shadows are cast in the opposite direction of the light source.
A, B, C, and D will all move backward and become larger as the light source moves backward above the objects.
